div.h3: The Sallie B. Howard School curriculum is based on the Common Core and Essential Standards as required by the state of North Carolina. This curriculum enables students to move progressively from Kindergarten through Twelfth grade building on their essential skills as they matriculate. It also ensures that students graduating from high school are prepared to enter credit-bearing courses at two- or -four-year college programs or to enter the workforce (College and Career Readiness or CCR).
SBHS participates in the State testing program and administers all end of year tests as well as other assessments the state deems appropriate.
